issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://msn.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fmsn.com) ### Comment Username: @mshea77 > Ads remain regardless of how AdGuard is set - MSN ads appear when using ad block, or when turning it off for the site. Previously I was able to block elements from the old adguard link that was available in the sub-menu. when trying to block ads from the new adguard extension that appears in the address bar, there is no way to select the element to block, either from the rotating ads at the top of the page, or from the banner in the middle of the page. i have been dealing with this for over a month and i cannot get any assistance from you guys whatsoever. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/bAkRzDB.jpg)
### System configuration Information | value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard/AdGuard Pro for iOS v4.4.4 Browser: | Safari DNS filtering: | server: `adguard`
Filters: | Ad Blocking:
AdGuard Base,
AdGuard Mobile Ads

Privacy:
AdGuard Tracking Protection

### Issue URL (Ads) [http://msn.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fmsn.com) ### Comment Username: @mshea77 > Ads remain regardless of how AdGuard is set - MSN ads appear when using ad block, or when turning it off for the site. Previously I was able to block elements from the old adguard link that was available in the sub-menu. when trying to block ads from the new adguard extension that appears in the address bar, there is no way to select the element to block, either from the rotating ads at the top of the page, or from the banner in the middle of the page. i have been dealing with this for over a month and i cannot get any assistance from you guys whatsoever. ### Screenshots

Also please update to 4.4.6

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.etsy.com/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.etsy.com%2F) ### Comment Username: @lewisje > A variety of third-party DNS providers, along with the regular AdGuard DNS, return the correct IP addresses for Etsy, but AdGuard Family returns 94.140.14.35 as the IP address for www.etsy.com; that turns out to be the blocked-site page, which fails with a privacy error because the blocked-site page does not have a TLS certificate for etsy.com and that domain has HSTS (one of the bundled HSTS pins in recent browsers), so the TLS failure cannot be bypassed (I forgot to open the "Advanced" button when taking that screenshot, but that's basically what that message said). > > I fail to see how Etsy qualifies as "adult content" worthy of blocking via the family filter. ### Screenshots

Not reproduced it on my end with AdGuard filters.
Try to leave only them and clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).
